item.title: Jeffrey add a quote by James Baldwin
item.description: "I imagine one of the reasons people cling to their hates so stubbornly is because they sense, once hate is gone, they will be forced to deal with pain." -- James Baldwin

item.title: Jeffrey add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Should I kill myself, or have a cup of coffee?" -- Albert Camus

item.title: Jeffrey add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "If you want a picture of the future, imagine a boot stamping on a human face—for ever." -- George Orwell

item.title: Jeffrey add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "The most effective way to destroy people is to deny and obliterate their own understanding of their history." -- George Orwell

item.title: Jeffrey add a quote by Barry Lopez
item.description: "Would the last animal, eating garbage and living on the last scrap of land, his mate dead, would he still forgive you?" -- Barry Lopez

item.title: Jeffrey add a quote by Edward Abbey
item.description: "Sentiment without action is the ruin of the soul." -- Edward Abbey

item.title: Jeffrey add a quote by Janisse Ray
item.description: "Of what use to humanity, I ask myself, is a man who cannot see beyond his own hurt?" -- Janisse Ray

item.title: Jeffrey add a quote by Noam Chomsky
item.description: "If we don't believe in freedom of expression for people we despise, we don't believe in it at all." -- Noam Chomsky

item.title: Jeffrey add a quote by Roberto Bolaño
item.description: "Reading is like thinking, like praying, like talking to a friend, like expressing your ideas, like listening to other people's ideas, like listening to music, like looking at the view, like taking a walk on the beach." -- Roberto Bolaño

item.title: Jeffrey add a quote by Louis-Ferdinand Celine
item.description: "To hell with reality! I want to die in music, not in reason or in prose. People don't deserve the restraint we show by not going into delirium in front of them. To hell with them!" -- Louis-Ferdinand Celine

item.title: Jeffrey add a quote by Robert Graves
item.description: "There's no money in poetry, but there's no poetry in money, either." -- Robert Graves

item.title: Jeffrey add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "I have always imagined that Paradise will be a kind of library." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Jeffrey add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "For beauty is nothing but the beginning of terror which we are barely able to endure, and it amazes us so, because it serenely disdains to destroy us. Every angel is terrible." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Jeffrey add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "Ah, how good it is to be among people who are reading!" -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Jeffrey add a quote by James Baldwin
item.description: "If the concept of God has any validity or any use, it can only be to make us larger, freer, and more loving. If God cannot do this, then it is time we got rid of Him." -- James Baldwin

item.title: Jeffrey add a quote by Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie
item.description: "As they walked out of the store, Ifemelu said, “I was waiting for her to ask ‘Was it the one with two eyes or the one with two legs?’ Why didn’t she just ask ‘Was it the black girl or the white girl?’” Ginika laughed. “Because this is America. You’re supposed to pretend that you don’t notice certain things." -- Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie
